item.title: MPI from R - Part One - The Basics
item.description: MPI is a standard for allowing a team of processes to solve a problem together. Various implementations of that standard exist; MPICH is perhaps the most well known. Microsoft MPI mimics MPICH on Windows, as does Intel MPI on various platforms. Typically you’d then include these libraries in projects written in C, C++, or Fortran. Furthermore, recent releases of Rtools have included support for Microsoft MPI. My plan is a couple of blogs on how to get this working, some exploration of performance, and an attempt at testing / CI.
